node.statement:
(Finiteness of Z = E_mu[exp(Psi^{ren})] and definition of limiting density R) Define Z := E_mu[exp(Psi^{ren})] and R(phi) := exp(Psi^{ren}(phi)) / Z.

CLAIM: (a) 0 < Z < infinity, so R is well-defined; (b) E_mu[R] = 1; (c) E_mu[exp(alpha Psi^{ren})] < infinity for all alpha in R.

PROOF OF (c): The renormalized exponent is Psi^{ren}(phi) = 4 lambda <psi, :phi^3:> - 6 lambda <psi^2, :phi^2:> + 4 lambda <psi^3, phi> + <(-Delta+m^2)psi, phi> (node 1.5.1, validated). This is a sum of four terms, each of the form c_j <f_j, :phi^{k_j}:> with c_j in R, f_j in C^inf(T^3), and k_j in {1, 2, 3}. For any alpha in R: alpha Psi^{ren} = sum_{j=1}^4 (alpha c_j) <f_j, :phi^{k_j}:>. By the elementary inequality exp(a_1 + ... + a_4) <= exp(4 a_1) ^{1/4} ... exp(4 a_4)^{1/4} (Holder with exponents (4,4,4,4)): E_mu[exp(alpha Psi^{ren})] <= prod_{j=1}^4 (E_mu[exp(4 alpha c_j <f_j, :phi^{k_j}:>)])^{1/4}. Each factor is finite: for k_j in {2,3}, the exponential integrability E_mu[exp(beta <f_j, :phi^{k_j}:>)] < infinity for all beta in R is established in node 1.6.2.10.3 (validated). For k_j = 1, the sub-Gaussian bound E_mu[exp(beta <f_j, phi>)] < infinity for all beta in R is established in node 1.6.2.5 (validated). Therefore E_mu[exp(alpha Psi^{ren})] < infinity for all alpha in R.

PROOF OF (a): Taking alpha = 1 in (c) gives Z = E_mu[exp(Psi^{ren})] < infinity. For Z > 0: since exp(Psi^{ren}(phi)) > 0 for all phi (the exponential is always positive), and Psi^{ren} is mu-a.s. finite (it is in L^p(mu) for all p >= 1 by node 1.5.3, so finite mu-a.s.), we have exp(Psi^{ren}) > 0 mu-a.s. Since E_mu[exp(Psi^{ren})] < infinity and exp(Psi^{ren}) > 0 mu-a.s., it follows that Z > 0.

PROOF OF (b): E_mu[R] = E_mu[exp(Psi^{ren})/Z] = Z/Z = 1 by definition.

NOTE: This construction of R uses ONLY the limiting measure mu and the limiting renormalized exponent Psi^{ren}. The divergent terms L_eps and K_eps are NOT present in the limit -- they have been absorbed into the renormalization. The normalization Z plays the role of the limiting version of exp(-K_eps) = E_{mu_eps}[exp(Psi_eps^{ren} + L_eps)].

DEPENDENCIES: Nodes 1.6.2.10.3, 1.6.2.5, 1.5.3, 1.5.1.
